DataElement.preferredName: Patient Disease Response Principal Investigator Approval Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to signify whether the Principal Investigator for a clinical trial has reviewed and approved a patient's disease response to treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Disease Response Principal Investigator Approval
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression._An investigator who is responsible for all aspects of the conduct of a study._Acceptance as satisfactory by an authoritative body; established by authority; given authoritative approval.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

Property.preferredDefinition: An investigator who is responsible for all aspects of the conduct of a study.:Acceptance as satisfactory by an authoritative body; established by authority; given authoritative approval.

Concepts.definition: An investigator who is responsible for all aspects of the conduct of a study.
Acceptance as satisfactory by an authoritative body; established by authority; given authoritative approval.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
